brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the prevalence, during the enrolment, of Left Ventricular Dysfunction diastolic and/or systolic in patients with diabetes mellitus type 2 without known or documented heart disease history and recognize its predictive clinical, biohumoral and with non-invasive techniques parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of Left Ventricular Dysfunction in patients with type II diabetes
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the prevalence of left ventricular dysfunction (LVD), diastolic or systolic in patients with type II diabetes mellitus in the absence of clinical signs/symptoms of cardiac abnormalities To identify the predictors of LVD

arm_group.description: Patients with: diabetes mellitus type 2 absence of heart disease previously reported age >45 years Informed Consent Patients without: presence of heart disease previously reported diabetes type 1 serious systemic disease, with an expected lifetime lower than 2 years no willingness to participate to the screening inadequate compliance to study procedure participation to other study

study_pop.textblock: Patients with diabetes mellitus type 2 without known or documented heart disease history and recognize its predictive clinical, biohumoral and with non-invasive techniques parameters.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diabetes mellitus type 2
- absence of heart disease previously reported
- age >45 years
- Informed Consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- presence of heart disease previously reported
- diabetes type 1
- serious systemic disease, with an expected lifetime lower than 2 years
- no willingness to participate to the screening
- inadequate compliance to study procedure
- participation to other study
